body: @bobdemp If you use `_logger.warn` instead of `_logger.info`, does it output something?
Just that and nothing in the container output

Hi

That does work but it seems only for 

```
_logger.warning("Test Output1")
```

info does not have an effect

```
_logger.info("Test Output2")
```

I tried running the container with

```
-e GUNICORN_CMD_ARGS="--log-level=info --timeout 60 -k gevent"
```

and tweaking the dockerfile

```
ENV GUNICORN_CMD_ARGS="--timeout 60 -k gevent --log-level=info"
```

but that had no effect on the the output
@bobdemp That's strange. Did you rebuild the docker image using the modified model wrapper?

I tried

```
# Build an image that can serve mlflow models.
FROM ubuntu:18.04

RUN apt-get -y update && apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends \
         wget \
         curl \
         nginx \
         ca-certificates \
         bzip2 \
         build-essential \
         cmake \
         openjdk-8-jdk \
         git-core \
         maven \
    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

# Download and setup miniconda
RUN curl -L https://repo.anaconda.com/miniconda/Miniconda3-latest-Linux-x86_64.sh >> miniconda.sh
RUN bash ./miniconda.sh -b -p /miniconda; rm ./miniconda.sh;
ENV PATH="/miniconda/bin:$PATH"
ENV JAVA_HOME=/usr/lib/jvm/java-8-openjdk-amd64
ENV GUNICORN_CMD_ARGS="--timeout 60 -k gevent --log-level=info"
RUN conda clean --all
# Set up the program in the image
WORKDIR /opt/mlflow

{install_mlflow}

{custom_setup_steps}
{entrypoint}
"""
```
@bobdemp My question is did you log a model using the modified model wrapper and build a new docker imgae that serves the model by running `mlflow models docker-build`?

@harupy 

So each time I make a change to the model I log it and promote it to the new staging model.  

```
mlflow.pyfunc.log_model(artifact_path=mlflow_pyfunc_model_path, python_model=ModelWrapper(version=model_esure_version), artifacts=artifacts, conda_env=conda_env, registered_model_name=model_name)
```

I then run

```
mlflow models build-docker -m "models:/bob_test1/Staging" -n "bob_test1:v1" --install-mlflow
```
@bobdemp Did you run `docker run ...` after these commamds?
